1: Yahweh is great and very worthy of praise in the city of our God, in his holy mountain.[b]
2: Beautiful in elevation, the joy of the whole earth, is Mount Zion,[c] in the far north,[d] the city of the great king.
3: God is in her citadels; he is known as a high stronghold.
4: For see, the kings assembled;[e] they advanced together.
5: They themselves saw[f] it, so they were astonished. They were terrified; they ran off.
6: Trembling seized them there— pain as of a woman in labor.
7: With an east wind you shatter[g] the ships of Tarshish.[h]
8: As we have heard, so we have seen in the city of Yahweh of hosts, in the city of our God. God will establish her forever. Selah
9: We have pondered your loyal love, O God, in the midst of your temple.
10: As is your name, O God, so is your praise to the ends of the earth. Your right hand is full of righteousness.
11: Let Mount Zion[i] rejoice; let the daughters of Judah rejoice because of your judgments.
12: Walk about Zion and circle it; count her towers.
13: Consider well[j] her ramparts. Go through her citadels so that you can tell the next generation
14: that this is God, our God forever and ever. He himself[k] will guide us until death.
